Browse the source code of codebrowser/gtsam/3rdparty/cephes/cephes/yn.c

1/* yn.c
2 *
3 * Bessel function of second kind of integer order
4 *
5 *
6 *
7 * SYNOPSIS:
8 *
9 * double x, y, yn();
10 * int n;
11 *
12 * y = yn( n, x );
13 *
14 *
15 *
16 * DESCRIPTION:
17 *
18 * Returns Bessel function of order n, where n is a
19 * (possibly negative) integer.
20 *
21 * The function is evaluated by forward recurrence on
22 * n, starting with values computed by the routines
23 * y0() and y1().
24 *
25 * If n = 0 or 1 the routine for y0 or y1 is called
26 * directly.
27 *
28 *
29 *
30 * ACCURACY:
31 *
32 *
33 * Absolute error, except relative
34 * when y > 1:
35 * arithmetic domain # trials peak rms
36 * IEEE 0, 30 30000 3.4e-15 4.3e-16
37 *
38 *
39 * ERROR MESSAGES:
40 *
41 * message condition value returned
42 * yn singularity x = 0 INFINITY
43 * yn overflow INFINITY
44 *
45 * Spot checked against tables for x, n between 0 and 100.
46 *
47 */
48
49/*
50 * Cephes Math Library Release 2.8: June, 2000
51 * Copyright 1984, 1987, 2000 by Stephen L. Moshier
52 */
53
54#include "mconf.h"
55extern double MAXLOG;
56
57double yn(int n, double x)
58{
59 double an, anm1, anm2, r;
60 int k, sign;
61
62 if (n < 0) {
63 n = -n;
64 if ((n & 1) == 0) /* -1**n */
65 sign = 1;
66 else
67 sign = -1;
68 }
69 else
70 sign = 1;
71
72
73 if (n == 0)
74 return (sign * y0(x));
75 if (n == 1)
76 return (sign * y1(x));
77
78 /* test for overflow */
79 if (x == 0.0) {
80 sf_error(func_name: "yn", code: SF_ERROR_SINGULAR, NULL);
81 return -INFINITY * sign;
82 }
83 else if (x < 0.0) {
84 sf_error(func_name: "yn", code: SF_ERROR_DOMAIN, NULL);
85 return NAN;
86 }
87
88 /* forward recurrence on n */
89
90 anm2 = y0(x);
91 anm1 = y1(x);
92 k = 1;
93 r = 2 * k;
94 do {
95 an = r * anm1 / x - anm2;
96 anm2 = anm1;
97 anm1 = an;
98 r += 2.0;
99 ++k;
100 }
101 while (k < n);
102
103
104 return (sign * an);
105}
106
